pros: Students are great and very respectful
cons: Some faculty complain too much and aren’t aware of how supportive the administration is to the faculty and staff

pros: I worked with an amazing team. My two direct supervisors were the best I have ever had! They were supportive in every aspect of the job. I would work for them any day of the week. Our team felt like a family. The CSS was the ONLY reason I was happy to go to work everyday.
cons: The college as a whole does not value to Center for Student Success. We were vastly over work and underpaid. Unfortunately, not matter how much my departmental supervisors fought for us it always fell on deaf ears. It was very apparent when the college laid off half of the department over an email. No notice was given to our supervisors and everyone was devastated.

job_title: Manager, Donor Engagement in Brooklyn Heights
pros: I had a great manager who supported me.
cons: After 4 months of employment I was terminated without any warning my manger did not event know.

pros: Friendly staff and supportive onboarding
cons: Toxic work culture, demanding, non diverse

review_title: I worked in a great department, but I'm not sure about the direction of the university overall

review_title: Great community to work at but overworked and underpaid
pros: Amazing community Growing number of students Brand new office locations

pros: The team of people in the department I worked in were all fantastic
cons: Was laid off with absolutely no warning. Atmosphere was cold and corporate, not appropriate for a college experience.

pros: good people in the service desk

pros: There are no pros whatsoever.
cons: Everything was a very bad experience.

pros: They have very flexible hours and plenty of vacation days since it is an academic institution. It surrounded by a variety of eateries so lunch is always something new and exciting. They have a very friendly staff and student body.
cons: There is not much of any cons that I can currently think of. The only thing I can think of is that the work can be tedious but I guess thats the nature of any desk job.

pros: Lovely working environment. I was able to learn a lot from my manager and develop skills. It was only a part time position-20h/week but it was def worth my time.
cons: it was a student worker position so for me there were not many downsides other than too much work for the number of employees

pros: Great staff, always willing to help, flexible hours, many graduates have the opportunity to start a full time job there after graduation
cons: Working with other student workers who don't give the same amount of time and effort to their duties, cleaning up their messes while they do half the work, they are not reprimanded and still get paid for it.

pros: This place is amazing to work for. I stared working here as a Spanish tutor and also as a front desk helper. During this time I was able to improve my tutoring skill and learn so much from my student.
cons: I don't have any negative feedback. This is a great place to work for. You can growth and make many contacts that can help you out for future jobs.

pros: SFC is a small college in a big city. The staff and administrators are very nice. This is a nice place to work. Relatively stress free. Promotional opportunities.
cons: I do not have any real "cons" other than to say that any college or university position is sometimes unpredictable in what you can expect. Students change, courses change.

pros: Solid returning student base; appreciative management; opportunities to coordinate between academic departments; great work/life/study balance.
cons: Some higher-ups engaged in  unprofessional conduct (workplace gossip, heated arguments, etc.); management attitudes wildly variable in past years.

pros: Although my internship was for a short period of time, I can say that there was a friendly work environment and I was supported not only with my colleagues but also with my manager.
cons: Since my internship was pretty short, I cannot state any cons during the time.

pros: Small classes, tons of activities and guest speakers
cons: Street parking is available, sometimes but not guaranteed.

pros: Working in the library allows me to interact with different people everyday! I love it.
cons: I honestly do not have any complaints. I wish I could help people more !

pros: Great students, very free to teach your way, open minded staff

pros: Family-like environment, good people and a great experience.
